Articles.Content:
This is for kerbin records like eva times, velocities, and other stuff.(speed,size,length,rediculessness)

also,if you think you made a record,post it here!

(NOTE: this is made to be sandbox capable, but if you made a record that just MUST be in science or career mode, than I will accept it.)

heaviest vtol:

Ahelicarrier by spartwo weighing at 460 tons currently

Fastest mun flag plant

I was proud of that trip to the Mun but I later saw a YouTube video of someone making it to the Mun's surface And Back to a soft landing on Kerbin in 59 minutes and 57 seconds. So mine would be a placeholder at best. But it is here:

http://imgur.com/a/r10j1

Long

est EVA:

20 years 229 days n counting :lab house

Fastest In-Atmosphere Flight

Treldon at 3393 link

Fastest Boat

185 m/s with the Jetty v2:treldon

Heaviest lifter

Zekes' Cira V

First successful stock SSTO round trip from KSC to Eve surface and back.

Nov 2nd 2014 using KrakBadger 2.5 link:slashy

First manned ion powered stock SSTO

Aug 15th 2014 link:tsevion

Land speed record for stock vehicle without rockets or jets,

787 m/secJul 31st 2014 link:Michael

Heaviest rover

108t:belfegor

longest time in command chair:

90 years: labhouse

First tripple ssto

goslash277:

http://s52.photobucket.com/user/GoSl...P/DoubleDipper

Edited December 3, 2014 by jake9039
more records

there is a thread but the OP hasn't updated it in a long long time.. maybe you can pick up where he left? there are some good entries in that one

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/12358-Kerbal-book-of-World-Records

If you do take this over, I submit a user named PLAD for landing on Mun and planting a flag within 43:33. He did it for a challenge I ran a while ago. It's pretty impressive

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64648-Min-Min-Mun-Challenge%21?p=1001594&viewfull=1#post1001594

I think i win heaviest stock VTOL Aircraft - the WAL 1. it's 193 tonnes, but can carry up to 300 more.

Download: http://www./download/22...qg/WAL+I.craft
*cough*

Perhaps some specific challenges for records such as how high you can get the basic three piece Career rocket to go and or how many contracts it can complete. ( Have set three and came up short the fourth altitude record with this one design using tweakables.)

Perhaps some specific challenges for records such as how high you can get the basic three piece Career rocket to go and or how many contracts it can complete. ( Have set three and came up short the fourth altitude record with this one design using tweakables.)

http://i.imgur.com/F2ulVN4.jpg

I was just thinking only records of speed, length, weight, time, cost, size, smallest, biggest, longest flight in atmosphere, longest flight in orbit, longest grand tour, mos science gained, etc...

*cough*

http://www./convkey/0979/hceao08hq09zboqfg.jpg

could you please include statistics and a craft file?

Edited November 21, 2014 by jake9039
I also have my new heaviest lifter - the new Cira V. Designed to carry 900 tonnes to LKO. She weighs 5,400 Tonnes. (not confirmed yet, but caclculations suggest it will).

I was proud of that trip to the Mun but I later saw a YouTube video of someone making it to the Mun's surface And Back to a soft landing on Kerbin in 59 minutes and 57 seconds. So mine would be a placeholder at best. But it is here:

http://imgur.com/a/r10j1

Will this thread accept a section on 'Lowest dV expended from LKO to...". I've been slowly collecting a number of those but it's somewhat specialized because of the number of rules in the entries.

While I personally own a few achievements that I believe are records, none of them are as impressive as this one:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/85728-Ion-glider-collier-trophy!?p=1548671&viewfull=1#post1548671

Tsevion launched the world's first (and as of this writing only) ion powered manned stock SSTO without the benefit of infiniglide on Nov 18th, 2014.

Best,

-Slashy

Edited November 22, 2014 by GoSlash27

Stuff that I did that's note-worthy:

First manned ion powered stock SSTO

Aug 15th 2014 link

First successful stock SSTO round trip from KSC to Eve surface and back.

Nov 2nd 2014 using KrakBadger 2.5 link

Land speed record for stock vehicle without rockets or jets, 787 m/sec

Jul 31st 2014 link

Best,

-Slashy

Edited November 22, 2014 by GoSlash27

I was proud of that trip to the Mun but I later saw a YouTube video of someone making it to the Mun's surface And Back to a soft landing on Kerbin in 59 minutes and 57 seconds. So mine would be a placeholder at best. But it is here:

http://imgur.com/a/r10j1

Will this thread accept a section on 'Lowest dV expended from LKO to...". I've been slowly collecting a number of those but it's somewhat specialized because of the number of rules in the entries.

it will be accepted, and it would be apreciated

While I personally own a few achievements that I believe are records, none of them are as impressive as this one:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/85728-Ion-glider-collier-trophy!?p=1548671&viewfull=1#post1548671

Tsevion launched the world's first (and as of this writing only) ion powered manned stock SSTO without the benefit of infiniglide on Nov 18th, 2014.

Best,

-Slashy

that will work!

Nice to see this thread growing so fast!

could you please include statistics and a craft file?

New version is a bit lighter at 460 tons but isn't finished. It should top out at 550 without fighters. I'll probably get longest flight with it aswell.

New version is a bit lighter at 460 tons but isn't finished. It should top out at 550 without fighters. I'll probably get longest flight with it aswell.

http://i.imgur.com/p5UBxMz.png

Looking forward to it. I saw someone had a perpetual flying machine and hope that they post here

submitting an entry for heaviest wheeled vehicle and heaviest object landed at minmus. the mobile science platform weighs 19.5t and the supply platform it docks to weighs in at 108t. + 33.4t with the skycrane attached. carreer mode with only 1 mod, KAS

Edited November 23, 2014 by Belphegor

Jake9039,

Please post Tsevion's achievement in lieu of mine if you need to. It is a much more difficult and historic feat than mine.

Thanks,

-Slashy

Not that spectacular compared to the others' achievement, but I am submitting my record for Fastest Boat

185 m/s with the Jetty v2

Javascript is disabled. View full album

(last screenshot shows 'only' 184.9 m/s though...)
In which category do suborbital boats go?

suborbital boats?

that might not be a boat

My longest Eva is 20 years 229 days n counting (stranded kerbals)

It is 90 years if you count a Eva command chair (forgot to close game and I had it warping)

My longest Eva is 20 years 229 days n counting (stranded kerbals)

It is 90 years if you count a Eva command chair (forgot to close game and I had it warping)

I am afraid that command chairs Aren't considered as an Eva, but get a classification all of their own. Sadly,the op is to complicated to veiw on mobile, and I had so many mods, I had to do a manual reset. Gonna have to wait a few hours.

Edited November 29, 2014 by jake9039

I don't see an entry for highest air speed (still in Keribn atmosphere), so I'll add one

Surface speed 3393 m/s

Imgur album (made for another challenge)

First triple SSTO spaceplane. Just accomplished it tonight!

December 2nd, 2014: GoSlash27 flew from KSC to orbital docking to KSC to orbital docking to KSC to orbital docking to KSC. That is, 3 entire round trips.

Without dropping any parts, refueling, or physics cheats using stock parts and stock installation. While carrying 2 flight crew and 4 passengers.

http://s52.photobucket.com/user/GoSlash27/slideshow/KSP/DoubleDipper

Best,

-Slashy
